revised_title: X-ray Microanalysis of Grain Boundary Segregation in Steels
tldr: This article discusses the use of X-ray microanalysis to study grain boundary segregation in steels. The technique helps in understanding the effects of residual elements and additives on the properties of steel, such as toughness, corrosion resistance, and life. The method requires uncontaminated intergranularly focused X-ray facilities for accurate results.
